title: libert19
author: libert19
content: Not a big deal, I'm just wondering.

comments.author: PX-Z
comments.body: Because you can't, i tried to create a topic in the latest version of smf[1] which is v2.1.3. Emojis that can be used on topic message icon on the latest version is still the same on this old smf forum software, unfortunately.[1] https://www.simplemachines.org

comments.author: BitcoinGirl.Club
comments.body: Quote from: libert19 on January 17, 2023, 11:07:03 AMNot a big deal, I'm just wondering. I don't depend on the emojis forum has by default. You will find more than enough on emojipedia.

comments.author: logfiles
comments.created_time: January 17, 2023, 03:39:37 PMLast edit: July 19, 2023, 08:23:08 PM by logfiles
comments.body: Quote from: BitcoinGirl.Club on January 17, 2023, 11:45:08 AMI don't depend on the emojis forum has by default. You will find more than enough on emojipedia.It's not possible to copy and paste an emoji from another site to the message Icon field, which I think was OP's interest.OP. I think the reason for limited number of emojis available by default is probably for the sake of the forum's functionality, like loading speed. Imagine that drop down menu having over 50 emojis
